channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Use Open Source Tools for a Righteous Cause (Artist Protection)
item.description: This (small) team is looking for a full-time, mid-level developer who loves independent music

item.title: Do you love customers? Senior Perl Developer with a product focus, London
item.description: Ever find yourself wishing you could see meaningful impact on users from your work?

item.description: As part of the Perl/Lambda adventure, Rob wrote a make-a-perl script that provisioned an EC2 to compile a version of perl.

January report of the Perl 6 Development Grant of Jonathan Worthington
A bunch of Perl one-liners to edit HTML files
item.description: I know some people will react to this with an automatic response 'never parse HTML with regex'. I wonder though, why talk in absolutes? Isn't it possible that someone might have special cases where the rule can and maybe even should be bended? Asking for a friend.

item.title: Request for Comments: Dave Rolsky's class at TPC 2019
item.description: Should Dave stop giving his class just because he also volunteers for TPF now? I don't think so, but what do you think?

item.title: graphviz describing multi-stage docker builds
item.description: An excellent and simple example (aren't those synonymes ?) on how to draw a simple DAG (Directed acyclic graph) to make hierarchy easier to grasp. It is also a 15 line long one-liner.

item.title: The Perl Conference in Pittsburgh - Call For Presentations
item.description: Sounds like fun. Will you be there? Do you give a presentation?

item.title: Get premium wall, floor and window custom decals at StickerYou.com
item.description: StickerYou doesn't only allow you to make custom stickers for your business. Brand your office, store or event with high-quality, customdecals. Make a huge impact and let the world know that your business is a force to be reckoned with. StickerYou.com allows you to order any size, shape and quantity. What are you waiting for? Get your office or store makeover started today at StickerYou.com! Use code PERL10 at checkout for an exclusive Perl Weekly discount.

item.title: #395 - What is DevOps for you?
item.description:
Hi,

What is DevOps for you? Is it a new job-title for system administrators who can also configure systems running 'in the cloud'?

Is it a team of people who provide tools to allow all the others to self-service when they need to build/release/deploy a new version of the software?

Is it a philosphy or development mode in which everyone in the organization, or at least in engineering, is responsible for the health of the technical environments? All of them. Including the development, testing, staging, and deployment environments.

Asking for a friend :)

ps.: It would be awesome if you shared your thoughts and experiences as a blog post and sent me the link. I could then link to them in the next edition.

Enjoy your week!
